attributes.action: Government must appoint Charles Moore to be Chairman of the BBC
attributes.additional_details: The BBC has become innaccceptably bias in its coverage and relentlessly pushes its left wing ‘woke’ agenda. The Government must bring back impartiality with the appointment of the highly distinguished former editor of the Daily Telegraph on a platform of abolishing the licence fee, by appointing Charles Moore as Chairman, when the current Chairman of the BBC’s three year term finishes in February 2021.
attributes.background: The BBC has become innaccceptably bias in its coverage and relentlessly pushes its left wing ‘woke’ agenda. The Government must bring back impartiality and abolish the licence fee, by appointing Charles Moore as Chairman

rejection.details:
We can't publish petitions about honours or appointments. That includes calling for particular individuals to be appointed to particular jobs.

If you want the Government to take action in relation to a particular policy or decision that's the responsibility of Government or the House of Commons, you could sign or start a petition about that.
